Main engine to create games

class bgameb.game.Game(name: str)[source]

Bases: BaseGame

Create the game object

Args must be a dicts

new(name: str, type_: Literal[typing.Literal['dice', 'card', 'step'], typing.Literal['shaker', 'bag', 'deck', 'steps'], typing.Literal['player']], target: Optional[str] = None, **kwargs) → None[source]

Add new component to game or any stuff to game-hosted tool or player

Parameters

  • name (str) – name of new component (must be unic)

  • type (COMPONENTS_TYPES) – type of new component

  • target (str, optional) – name of class, where placed component. Defaults to None.

Raises

ComponentClassError – target or type of component not exist

copy(source: str, target: str, **kwargs) → None[source]

Copy stuff from game object to any game-hosted tool or player

Parameters

  • source (str) – name of copied stuff

  • target (str) – name of tool or player, where placed copy

Raises

ComponentClassError – target or source not exist

As result this operation we need two classes inside Game object: - target Component-like stuff - source Component-like tool

When method was called, is created new Component with all attributes of source class and it placed in target class

bgameb.players module

Game players classes

class bgameb.players.BasePlayer(name: str, is_active: bool = True, has_priority: bool = False, team: ~typing.Optional[str] = None, owner_of: ~typing.List[str] = <factory>, user_of: ~typing.List[str] = <factory>)[source]

Bases: Base

Base class for game players and bots

Attrs

  • name (str): player name

  • counter (Counter): counter object for count any items

  • has_priority (bool): Default to False

  • team (str, optioanl): team name for this player

  • owner_of (List[str]): list of objects owned by player Default to []

  • user_of (List[str]): list of objects used by player Default to []

Args must be a dicts

counter: Counter
is_active: bool = True
has_priority: bool = False
team: Optional[str] = None
owner_of: List[str]
user_of: List[str]

class bgameb.stuff.Dice(name: str, count: int = 1, sides: int = 2, _type: str = 'dice')[source]

Bases: BaseStuff

Base class for define types of rolled or fliped objects

Define name to identify later this object by unique name. For example: ‘six_side’

Sides attr define number of sides of roller. Default to 2. Sides can’t be less than 2, because one-sided roller is strongly determined and 0zero-sided is imposible.

Example:
    dice = Dice(name='coin', sides=2)
Raises

StuffDefineError – number of sides less than 2

Args must be a dicts

sides: int = 2
roll() → List[int][source]

Roll and return result

Returns

result of roll

Return type

List[int]

class bgameb.stuff.Card(name: str, count: int = 1, open: bool = False, tapped: bool = False, side: ~typing.Optional[str] = None, counter: ~collections.Counter = <factory>, _type: str = 'card')[source]

Bases: BaseStuff

Create the card

Define name to identify later this object by unique name. For example: ‘unique_card’

Example:
    card = CardType(name='unique_card')

Args must be a dicts

open: bool = False
tapped: bool = False
side: Optional[str] = None
counter: Counter
flip() → None[source]

Face up or face down the card regardles of it condition

face_up() → None[source]

Face up the card and return text

face_down() → None[source]

Face down the card

tap(side='right') → None[source]

Tap the card to the given side

Parameters

side (str, optional) – sifde to tap. Defaults to ‘right’.

untap() → None[source]

Untap the card

alter() → None[source]

Many cards have alter views. For example card can have main view, that apply most time of the game and second view, that apply only if card played as that alternative. For ease of understanding, consider that different views of the same card are not related directly to each other.

bgameb.tools module

Game tools classes like shakers or decks

class bgameb.tools.BaseTool(name: str)[source]

Bases: Base

Base class for game tools (like decks or shakers)

Args must be a dicts

update(name: str, game: Base, count: int = 1) → None[source]

Add or increase count of stuff in tool

Parameters

  • name (str) – name of stuff.

  • game (BaseGame) – game instance object.

  • count (int, optional) – count of stuff copy Defaults to 1.

Raises

StuffDefineError – count of stuff nonpositive or stuff not exist

remove(name: Optional[str] = None, count: Optional[int] = None) → None[source]

Remove any kind of stuff copy from tool by its name and count

Parameters

  • name (str, optional) – name of stuff. Defaults to None.

  • count (int, optional) – count of stuff. Defaults to None.

You can use any combination for names and counts to remove all stuff, all or any by name or by count.

Raises

StuffDefineError – nonpositive integer for count

class bgameb.tools.Deck(name: str, _type: str = 'deck', current: ~typing.Deque[~bgameb.stuff.BaseStuff] = <factory>)[source]

Bases: Bag

Create deck for cards

Deck ia a Bag class that conyain current deck property for define queued deck representation

You can add cards, define it counts and deal a deck. Result is saved in current deck attr as deque object. This object has all methods of python deque

Example:
    deque(Card1, Card3, Card2, Card4)

Args must be a dicts

current: Deque[BaseStuff]
deal() → None[source]

Deal new random shuffled deck and save it to self.current: List[str]

shuffle() → None[source]

Shuffle current deck

to_arrange(start: int, end: int) → Tuple[List[BaseStuff], Tuple[List[BaseStuff], List[BaseStuff]]][source]

Prepare current deck to arrange

Parameters

  • start (int) – start of slice

  • end (int) – end of slice

Start and end cant be less than 0 and end must be greater than start. Arranged deck are splited to three part - left, center and right. You can rearrange center part and concatenate that in new deque by arrange() method.

Returns

part to arrange

Return type

Tuple[List[BaseStuff], Tuple[List[BaseStuff]]

arrange(arranged: List[BaseStuff], last: List[Deque[BaseStuff]]) → None[source]

Compone new current deck deck with given arranged list and last of deck. Use to_arrange() method to get liat to arrange and last of deck before arrange.

Parameters

  • arranged (List[BaseStuff]) – arranged list of cards

  • last – (Deque[BaseStuff]): last of deck deque

search(query: Dict[str, int], remove: bool = True) → List[BaseStuff][source]

Search for cards in current deck

Parameters

  • query (Dict[str, int]) – dict with name of searched card and count of seartching

  • remove (bool) – if True - remove cards from current deck. Default to True

Returns

list of finded cards

Return type

List[Card]

Example:
    game.deck1.search(
        {'card1': 2,
         'card2': 1 },
        remove=False
        )

Bases: RuntimeError
